author: adenan44
title: Climate Change
description: Quel problème mondial pouvons-nous essayer de résoudre pour rendre le Cardano populaire ?

f6_assessments.q0:
Disclaimer: my view points are shaped by my multi-year experience in product management and software development. 

The proposal raises an important social topic, which is relevant given the mission of Cardano to provide a social and financial operating system to the world.

However, this proposal does not directly support any of Fund 8 strategic goals: grow controbitors, make Cardano into an open-source project, grow the dev and app ecosystem.

In addition, the proposal would be stronger if it provided an overview of use cases in which Cardano could achieve a noticeable progress with the problem and some recent success stories to provide some estimates for the expected impact and resources necessary.

To make this proposal stronger and more aligned with the Fund 8 objectives, I can propose the following: consider creating a proposal within Dapps and Integrations challenge to build apps/services for helping people to self-organize around important social issues.

I have made the following deductions:
- 2 points because this objective does not support strategic goals of Fund 8.
- 1 point for the lack of the discusion about the ability to achieve a noticeable impact. My rating is 2.
f6_assessments.q1:
Given the scale of the issue and the struggles of the global community to solve it, it is hard to believe that an initiative with just $75k of funding can have a noticeable impact on the global climate.

This proposal would be stronger, if it provided examples of high-ROI solutions that can noticeably impact the problem and if some of those solutions can benefit from the Cardano technological stack.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of specific vision of how Cardano-based solutions can help.
- 1 point for the lack of the discussion about sufficiency of the requested funds to achieve a noticeable impact.
- 1 point because of the general complexity of this global issue.
- 1 point for the lack of examples of success stories showing how blockchain community can drive impact.
My rating is 1.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal names some metrics (the number of initiaitves, the number of people reached) which help track only some activity with the initiative but not the progress in addressing the set problem.

In addition, the proposal would be stronger if it consider metrics evaluating the impact on the cardano ecosystem, user satisfaction and the general competitiveness of the developed solutions.

For example, some of the following metrics could be helpful:
1) the % of the global CO2 emissions that were offset/reduced through the projects within this initiative.
2) the cost of reducing the global CO2 emissions by 1% in comparison with alternative approaches.
3) the % of Cardano users brough into the ecosystem through projects in this initiative.
4) user satisfaction with the developed solutions in comparison with available alternatives.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of metrics tracking the progress of addressing the problem.
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating the impact on Cardano ecosystem.
- 1 point for the lack of metrics the competitiveness of the solutions.
My rating is 2.
